news.title: Microsoft MFA Down – 504 Gateway Timeout Errors Disrupting MFA ...
news.summary: Monitor the Service Health dashboard in the Microsoft 365 admin center for updates on MO1237461. ... Endpoint Security Next Generation NGAV AV Cryptika ...
news.content: Microsoft is currently investigating a significant service degradation affecting Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) across its Microsoft 365 suite, with users in the North America region reporting widespread 504 gateway timeout errors when attempting to authenticate into MFA-protected services. The incident, tracked under issue ID MO1237461 , began at approximately 8:22 PM IST (2:52 PM UTC) on February 23, 2026, and remains under active investigation. Users attempting to complete MFA challenges are encountering 504 Gateway Timeout responses, effectively blocking access to Microsoft 365 applications, portals, and any downstream services that rely on MFA as part of their authentication flow. The 504 error indicates that an upstream server, in this case, likely within Microsoft’s authentication infrastructure, is failing to respond within the expected time window, causing the gateway layer to return a timeout to the end user. Microsoft confirmed the incident on its service health dashboard
news.score_reason: LLM: Critical for MFA-protected users experiencing service degradation, directly impacting their ability to work securely.

news.title: Demystifying CompTIA Security+: Your Gateway to a Cybersecurity ...
news.summary: Explore the CompTIA Security+ certification, a crucial entry-level credential for aspiring cybersecurity professionals. Understand its core domains, ...
news.content: Thinking about diving into the world of cybersecurity? It's a field that's not just growing, it's exploding, and for good reason. With the digital landscape constantly evolving, the need for skilled professionals to protect our data and systems has never been greater. If you're looking for that crucial first step, that solid foundation to launch your career, then the CompTIA Security+ certification often comes up. It's like the handshake that gets you into the room, validating that you've got the core skills employers are looking for. So, what exactly is this Security+ all about? Essentially, it's an entry-level credential from CompTIA, a respected non-profit trade association. Think of it as a benchmark. Earning it tells potential employers, 'Hey, I understand the fundamentals of IT security and I'm ready to contribute.' For many, it's the very first certification they pursue on their journey into information security, and it opens doors to a wealth of job opportunities. What makes Se

news.title: Saudi Petrochemical-Refining Integration - SAUDI VISION 2030
news.summary: The flagship expression of this integration strategy is the Ras Al-Khair complex and the broader Jubail Industrial City expansion. Jubail, already the world's ...
news.content: Overview KPIs Timeline Analysis Advertisement Saudi Petrochemical-Refining Integration Saudi Arabia’s petrochemical-refining integration strategy represents one of the most consequential industrial transformations in the Kingdom’s modern economic history. By systematically linking upstream hydrocarbon extraction with downstream chemical manufacturing, Saudi Arabia is constructing an industrial architecture designed to capture maximum value from every barrel of crude oil produced — a fundamental reorientation from volume-based commodity export toward margin-rich processed materials. Strategic Context and Vision 2030 Alignment The integration of petrochemical and refining operations sits at the heart of Vision 2030’s industrial diversification mandate. Historically, the Kingdom exported the vast majority of its crude output as unprocessed feedstock, ceding the higher-margin conversion economics to refiners and chemical producers in Asia, Europe, and North America. The strategic pivot tow

news.title: Sabic, Pirelli sign supply deal for Saudi tire project
news.summary: As part of the deal, Sabic will provide polybutadiene rubber and carbon black to the project, which will have a nameplate capacity to produce 3.5 million ...
news.content: Home News Sabic, Pirelli sign supply ... Back to News Sabic, Pirelli sign supply deal for Saudi tire project 23 Feb 2026 Share: Saudi materials group to supply rubber, carbon black for $550m tire production plant Riyadh – Saudi Basic Industries Corp. (Sabic) has signed a deal with Pirelli and its Saudi joint venture partner Public Investment Fund (PIF) for the supply of raw materials for a greenfield tire production facility, currently under construction in western Saudi. As part of the deal, Sabic will provide polybutadiene rubber and carbon black to the project, which will have a nameplate capacity to produce 3.5 million passenger car tires per year. The agreement, said Sabic in a 15 Feb statement, is “first of its kind” as it supplies raw materials for producing car tires locally in the kingdom. Pirelli and PIF launched the $550 (€470 million) tire project in late 2023, with the aim to start production in 2026. At the time, Pirelli said the new factory is being constructed in antici

news.content: Modeling and optimization approaches for joint maintenance scheduling in the context of industry 4.0 Critical Review Published: 24 February 2026 ( 2026 ) Cite this article Save article View saved research The International Journal of Advanced Manufacturing Technology Aims and scope Submit manuscript Abstract The ongoing evolution of industrial systems, driven by Industry 4.0 technologies and increasing uncertainty in production environments, has significantly complicated the coordination of production and maintenance activities. In response to these challenges, research on scheduling problems has expanded considerably in recent years. This paper provides a structured review of the main scheduling models proposed for different workshop configurations, including flow shop, job shop, and open shop settings, with a particular focus on maintenance-related constraints. news.content: Download Brochure What Is a Heat Exchanger Manufacturer? Complete Guide for 2026 In the intricate world of industrial processing, a Heat Exchanger Manufacturer is far from just a hardware vendor; they are thermal designers. As we move through the industrial requirements of 2026, the importance of energy conservation and the reduction of carbon emissions have made heat exchangers the "lungs" of today's industrial plant. For plant operators and process engineers, the objective is no longer simply transferring heat; it is to achieve maximum heat recovery with a minimum pressure drop. With the help of an experienced heat exchanger manufacturer such as Rahul Engineering Global Pvt. Ltd. , you can be assured that your thermal systems are designed for the high-intensity applications of the current chemical, pharmaceutical, and oil industry. news.title: Emerging Trends in Mechanical Engineering
news.summary: Explore additive manufacturing and other new developments in mechanical engineering. Learn about CWRU's online MS in Mechanical Engineering program.
news.content: From tiny, tooth-scrubbing robots 1 to rockets capable of deep space exploration, 2 the field of mechanical engineering is on the cutting edge of new technologies. These exciting advancements are both powered by and driving mechanical engineering. If you want to stay relevant in this fast-paced industry, you need to stay up to date on the latest trends. 3 Read on to explore several of the most recent mechanical engineering trends and ways in which they’re likely to be implemented in the near future. Sustainable Engineering and Renewable Energy Sustainable engineering is the integration of sustainability principles into the design, operation and disposal of mechanical systems and products. Sustainability involves focus on reducing environmental impact, enhancing efficiency and promoting the use of renewable resources. Increasing awareness of climate change and environmental degradation is driving the demand for sustainable engineering solutions. 4 Governments, industries and consumers a

news.title: Predictive maintenance robotics: How AI is redefining industrial ...
news.summary: Discover how predictive maintenance robotics uses AI, machine learning, and real-time sensor data to reduce downtime, prevent equipment failure, and improve ...
news.content: Predictive maintenance robotics is transforming how industrial organisations manage automation environments, moving beyond reactive maintenance and fixed schedules toward intelligent, data-driven maintenance strategies. Instead of waiting for equipment failures or relying solely on manual inspections, organisations are deploying machine learning, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics to optimise maintenance scheduling and reduce costly downtime. In many industrial facilities, robotic diagnostics are now aligned with structured systems such as velappity’s hvac preventive maintenance software to ensure predictive maintenance processes integrate with enterprise asset management frameworks across different locations. This shift represents more than incremental improvement. Predictive maintenance uses real time data, historical data and performance metrics to detect anomalies, predict failures and minimise downtime before unexpected failures escalate into catastrophic failures. The

news.content: Alibaba Industrial Machinery Refrigeration & Heat Exchange Equipment Boilers & Parts Boilers A Complete Guide to Mini Pressurized Boiler: Specifications, Types, and Applications Leo Turner • February 20, 2026 • 3 min read Types of Mini Pressurized Boilers A mini pressurized boiler is a compact, efficient heating system designed for small to medium-scale applications. These boilers operate under pressure to increase efficiency and heat transfer, making them ideal for environments where space and energy conservation are critical. Available in several configurations, each type of mini pressurized boiler is engineered to meet specific operational needs—from residential comfort to industrial processing. Steam Boilers Mini steam boilers generate pressurized steam used in heating systems and industrial processes. They are commonly deployed in manufacturing and food processing industries.
